IPC Routes

Redis in-memory db is used as IPC mechanism, all IpcNode subscribes to pubsub “ipc” channel, the messages routing to the good nodes is abstracted by the Route system.

Tip

See ipc for more details about the IPC system.

This page describes and references all IPC Routes used by components.

Logs

Route

Data structure

Purpose

log.<level>.<label>.*

{“label”: <label>, “level”: <level>, “message”: <message>}

Used to send a log message from <label> to the log system using <level> as log level, this route can be completed with any additional filter. This route is used by the src.nemesis_utilities.utilities.ipc.IpcNode.log() method.

stdout

{“message”: <message>}

Every single messages sent to the terminal (stdout) is sent to this route. This route is used by the src.nemesis_utilities.utilities.ipc._StdOverrider() class.

stderr

{“message”: <message>}

Every single messages sent to the terminal (stderr) is sent to this route. This route is used by the src.nemesis_utilities.utilities.ipc._StdOverrider() class.
